Posts.Content: Dec 9, 2016 06:51PM woeisme wrote: I started a new thread because it's a different topic. I thought a thread about what is mobile or not would be helpful to the community especially based on your comment saying people (men and women) come here and think their lump is immobile etc.  A mod can delete or merge this new thread if that is an issue
Posts.Title: What exactly is a "mobile lump"? woeisme woeisme

Posts.Content: woeisme wrote: okay, question time! What exactly is a "mobile lump," and how did yours interact/move about inside of the breast? I found a lump 2 months ago near the surface of my "breast" by the nipple. The doctor said it was mobile, however, when I feel it more in depth I now realize that the top and sides are not adhered to anything, but the bottom (facing my chest wall) seems to be; though it's not adhered to the chest wall itself it feels as though it's connected to breast tissue maybe. I can run my finger along the top of the lump and around the perimeter of it, which is round/oval in shape, however, I can not get to the bottom of the lump. I can feel where the lump ends and the tissue starts. Shouldn't I be able to lift the lump up and run my finger beneath it? Getting a hold of the lump is difficult because it jumps from my fingers like a fish out of water, but if this lump were truly "mobile" wouldn't it be detached on all sides? Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: What exactly is a "mobile lump"? woeisme woeisme

Posts.Content: Dec 9, 2016 11:55PM woeisme wrote: this thread wasn't supposed to be about me.it was supposed to allow others to share what theirs felt like. I just shared my own story and added a question at the end. Guess that's the end of my attempt
